cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 345 miles SSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north-northeast just off the southeast U.S. Atlantic coast, then turning northeast and away from the U.S. after brushing the Outer Banks of North Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near / just east of the Outer Banks, North Carolina

weather_observation.warning_coast: Surf City NC to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Atlantic coastline from northeast Florida through the Carolinas, with greatest impact expected along the North Carolina Outer Banks
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (no wind-probability site near Tampa in table)
weather_observation.wind: No significant tropical-storm-force winds expected at Tampa Port Authority, FL
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – Arthur remains on Atlantic side, no Gulf surge expected
weather_observation.rainfall: None – rain shield stays east of the Florida peninsula
weather_observation.other_hazards: Possible enhanced rip currents along Atlantic beaches of Florida, but minimal effect on Gulf-side Tampa operations
